title: C04-1036

sentences.text: We suggest a new goal and evaluation criterion for word similarity measures .

The new criterion -- meaning-entailing substitutability -- fits the needs of semantic-oriented NLP applications and can be evaluated directly -LRB- independent of an application -RRB- at a good level of human agreement .

Motivated by this semantic criterion we analyze the empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors and its impact on word similarity results , proposing an objective measure for evaluating feature vector quality .
Finally , a novel feature weighting and selection function is presented , which yields superior feature vectors and better word similarity performance .

Entity-the_new_criterion.label: The new criterion
Entity-the_new_criterion.description: The new criterion refers to 'meaning-entailing substitutability', a goal and evaluation standard for word similarity measures that is designed to meet the requirements of semantic-oriented natural language processing applications and can be assessed independently with a high level of human agreement.

Entity-a_new_goal_and_evaluation_criteri.label: a new goal and evaluation criterion for word similarity measures
aliases: a new goal and evaluation criterion for word similarity measures
Entity-a_new_goal_and_evaluation_criteri.description: The entity refers to a proposed standard called 'meaning-entailing substitutability' that serves as a new goal and evaluation criterion for assessing the effectiveness of word similarity measures in semantic-oriented natural language processing applications.

mentions.local_name: a new goal and evaluation criterion for word similarity measures

Entity-meaning-entailing_substitutabilit.label: meaning-entailing substitutability
Entity-meaning-entailing_substitutabilit.description: Meaning-entailing substitutability is a proposed evaluation criterion for word similarity measures that aligns with semantic-oriented natural language processing applications and allows for independent assessment with high human agreement.

Entity-objective_measure_for_evaluating_.label: objective measure for evaluating feature vector quality
aliases: an objective measure for evaluating feature vector quality
objective measure for evaluating feature vector quality
Entity-objective_measure_for_evaluating_.description: An objective measure designed to assess the quality of feature vectors used in word similarity evaluations, based on a new semantic criterion that emphasizes meaning-entailing substitutability.

mentions.local_name: objective measure for evaluating feature vector quality
an objective measure for evaluating feature vector quality

Entity-goal.label: goal
Entity-goal.description: The term 'goal' refers to a newly proposed evaluation criterion for word similarity measures, specifically focusing on meaning-entailing substitutability to enhance semantic-oriented NLP applications.

Entity-a_new_goal.label: a new goal
Entity-a_new_goal.description: A new goal refers to the proposed evaluation criterion for word similarity measures, specifically meaning-entailing substitutability, aimed at enhancing semantic-oriented NLP applications.

Entity-feature_vector_quality.label: feature vector quality
Entity-feature_vector_quality.description: Feature vector quality refers to an objective measure used to evaluate the empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors in the context of word similarity measures, particularly in semantic-oriented NLP applications.

Entity-semantic_criterion.label: semantic criterion
Entity-semantic_criterion.description: The 'semantic criterion' refers to the evaluative standard of meaning-entailing substitutability used to assess the quality of word similarity measures in natural language processing.

Entity-word_similarity_performance.label: word similarity performance
Entity-word_similarity_performance.description: Word similarity performance refers to the effectiveness of evaluating how closely related or similar two words are based on their feature vectors, particularly in the context of semantic-oriented natural language processing applications.

Entity-better_word_similarity_performanc.label: better word similarity performance
Entity-better_word_similarity_performanc.description: Better word similarity performance refers to the improved effectiveness of word similarity measures achieved through the use of superior feature vectors resulting from a novel feature weighting and selection function.

Entity-feature_weighting_and_selection_f.label: feature weighting and selection function
aliases: novel feature weighting and selection function
a novel feature weighting and selection function
Entity-feature_weighting_and_selection_f.description: The feature weighting and selection function is a novel algorithm designed to enhance the quality of feature vectors in natural language processing by optimizing the selection and importance of features, thereby improving word similarity performance.

mentions.local_name: novel feature weighting and selection function
a novel feature weighting and selection function

Entity-word_similarity_measure.label: word similarity measures
Entity-word_similarity_measure.description: Word similarity measures are quantitative metrics used to assess the degree of similarity between words based on various linguistic or contextual criteria.

Entity-it_impact_on_word_similarity_resu.label: its impact on word similarity results
aliases: its impact on word similarity results
Entity-it_impact_on_word_similarity_resu.description: The term 'its impact on word similarity results' refers to the influence of the empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors on the effectiveness and accuracy of measuring word similarity in semantic-oriented natural language processing applications.

mentions.local_name: its impact on word similarity results

Entity-empirical_quality_of_distribution.label: empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors
aliases: the empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors
empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors
Entity-empirical_quality_of_distribution.description: The empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors refers to the effectiveness and reliability of vector representations of words based on their distributional properties in language, which is analyzed in the context of their influence on word similarity measures.

mentions.local_name: empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors
the empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors

Entity-a_good_level_of_human_agreement.label: a good level of human agreement
aliases: a good level of human agreement
Entity-a_good_level_of_human_agreement.description: A good level of human agreement refers to the degree of consensus among human evaluators when assessing the quality or appropriateness of word similarity measures based on the proposed criterion of meaning-entailing substitutability.

mentions.local_name: a good level of human agreement

Entity-word_similarity_result.label: word similarity results
Entity-word_similarity_result.description: Word similarity results refer to the outcomes of assessments that quantify the degree of similarity between words based on various linguistic or computational criteria.

Entity-distributional_word_feature_vecto.label: distributional word feature vectors
Entity-distributional_word_feature_vecto.description: Distributional word feature vectors are numerical representations of words that capture their meanings based on the contexts in which they appear, commonly used in natural language processing to analyze semantic relationships and similarities between words.

Entity-empirical_quality.label: empirical quality
Entity-empirical_quality.description: The term 'empirical quality' refers to the measurable effectiveness and reliability of distributional word feature vectors in capturing semantic similarity, as assessed through an objective evaluation metric.

Entity-superior_feature_vector.label: superior feature vectors
Entity-superior_feature_vector.description: Superior feature vectors refer to enhanced representations of words that are generated through a novel feature weighting and selection function, leading to improved performance in word similarity tasks within semantic-oriented natural language processing applications.

Entity-human_agreement.label: human agreement
Entity-human_agreement.description: Human agreement refers to the level of consensus or alignment among human evaluators when assessing the quality of word similarity measures, indicating a reliable standard for evaluation in semantic-oriented NLP applications.

Entity-feature_vector.label: feature vectors
Entity-feature_vector.description: Feature vectors are numerical representations of data points in a multi-dimensional space, commonly used in machine learning and natural language processing to capture the characteristics of objects or words for various analytical tasks.

Entity-evaluation_criterion.label: evaluation criterion
Entity-evaluation_criterion.description: An evaluation criterion is a standard or metric used to assess the quality or effectiveness of a particular process, method, or measurement.

Entity-criterion.label: criterion
Entity-criterion.description: A criterion is a standard or principle by which something is judged or evaluated, often used in the context of assessment or measurement.

Entity-objective_measure.label: objective measure
Entity-objective_measure.description: An objective measure is a standardized evaluation metric used to assess the quality or performance of a particular entity or process based on quantifiable data.

Entity-semantic-oriented_nlp_application.label: semantic-oriented NLP applications
Entity-semantic-oriented_nlp_application.description: Semantic-oriented NLP applications are software tools and systems that utilize natural language processing techniques to understand, interpret, and generate human language based on its meaning and semantics.

summary: We suggest a new goal and evaluation criterion for word similarity measures . The new criterion -- meaning-entailing substitutability -- fits the needs of semantic-oriented NLP applications and can be evaluated directly -LRB- independent of an application -RRB- at a good level of human agreement . Motivated by this semantic criterion we analyze the empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors and its impact on word similarity results , proposing an objective measure for evaluating feature vector quality . Finally , a novel feature weighting and selection function is presented , which yields superior feature vectors and better word similarity performance .

Predicate-is_suggested_as.label: is suggested as
Predicate-is_suggested_as.description: The predicate 'is suggested as' indicates a recommendation or proposal where the subject is being put forward or advocated for a specific role, function, or identity represented by the object. It implies that the subject is considered suitable or beneficial in the context defined by the object, often reflecting an opinion or conclusion drawn from analysis or discussion.

Predicate-is_evaluated_by.label: is evaluated by
Predicate-is_evaluated_by.description: The predicate 'is evaluated by' establishes a relationship where the subject is assessed or judged based on the criteria or standards represented by the object. This indicates that the object serves as a benchmark or measure against which the performance, effectiveness, or quality of the subject is determined.

Predicate-fits_the_needs_of.label: fits the needs of
Predicate-fits_the_needs_of.description: The predicate 'fits the needs of' establishes a relationship where the subject is aligned or compatible with the requirements, preferences, or expectations of the object. It implies that the subject provides a suitable solution, support, or functionality that addresses the specific demands or characteristics of the object, thereby indicating a beneficial or effective match between the two.

Predicate-can_be_evaluated_at.label: can be evaluated at
Predicate-can_be_evaluated_at.description: The predicate 'can be evaluated at' indicates the capability of the subject to undergo assessment or measurement in relation to the object, which represents a specific standard, criterion, or level of performance. This connection implies that the subject's effectiveness, quality, or suitability can be determined by examining how well it aligns with or meets the specified object.

Predicate-motivates.label: motivates
Predicate-motivates.description: The predicate 'motivates' establishes a relationship in which the subject serves as a driving force or reason that influences or encourages the characteristics or behaviors represented by the object. In this context, it implies that the subject provides the necessary impetus or rationale that leads to the development, enhancement, or understanding of the object.

Predicate-impacts.label: impacts
Predicate-impacts.description: The predicate 'impacts' denotes a relationship where the subject exerts an influence or effect on the object, indicating that changes or characteristics of the subject can lead to variations or outcomes in the object. This connection suggests a directional flow of influence, where the state or quality of the subject has the potential to alter, enhance, or diminish the properties or results associated with the object.

Predicate-analyzes.label: analyzes
Predicate-analyzes.description: The predicate 'analyzes' denotes an action where the subject systematically examines or investigates the object in order to understand its structure, characteristics, or underlying principles. This process often involves breaking down the object into its components and evaluating their relationships or significance, thereby providing insights or conclusions about the object based on the subject's criteria or framework.

Predicate-proposes.label: proposes
Predicate-proposes.description: The predicate 'proposes' indicates a relationship where the subject puts forward a suggestion, idea, or plan that is intended to address, solve, or enhance the understanding of the object. In this context, the subject is advocating for a specific approach or method that is represented by the object, which serves as a potential solution or framework related to the subject's domain.

Predicate-yields.label: yields
Predicate-yields.description: The predicate 'yields' indicates a causal or productive relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject produces, generates, or results in the object. It implies that the action or process represented by the subject leads to the creation or emergence of the object, which is often seen as a desirable or beneficial outcome.

Predicate-is.label: is
Predicate-is.description: The predicate 'is' serves as a linking verb that establishes an identity or equivalence between the subject and the object. It indicates that the subject can be defined or characterized by the object, suggesting that they are fundamentally the same or that the object provides essential information about the subject.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or concept that falls under the more general category represented by the object. This relationship implies that the object encompasses a wider range of meanings or instances than the subject, thereby situating the subject within a broader conceptual framework.
